comment: wouldn't take him again but he's not awful. my biggest complaints are that attendance is mandatory and part of your grade when most of the learning is done on smartbooks and the fact that he gives the most vague instructions for assignments and expects you to know what he means. he is a very easy grader though, got 100s every essay and theres a lot

I'm not sure where to start. He's not a bad guy, but as a professor, he is really bad. He talks quietly so you can't hear what's being said, he gives ZERO instruction on how to complete assignments, and he tends to be condescending in weird ways (if you're curious what I mean, take him and find out). Avoid him.
Was not a good professor would stay far away.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: The course content is difficult as is and he doesn't provide clear assignment instructions. He constantly wants to use Microsoft Teams instead of D2L which makes the course more confusing. The group project is an absurd amount of work for a small percentage of your overall grade. Teters is a nice man but avoid taking this course online if you can.

May god have mercy on your poor soul if you don't have good team members to do the project with... Other than that the rest of the course was fine. Material can sometimes be difficult but if you ask him for help he WILL respond to you within that same day. Also you get to use notes on the exam which was the only reason I passed so take him.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: BY NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHOULD YOU TAKE HIS CLASS. single handedly the most unorganized and inadequate professor on the Kennesaw campus. test take up Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. and the instructions for the group project are very misleading. the instructions on the syllabus are different from the ones he provides and none of it makes any sense.

Glad I took this class over the summer to get this out of the way cause this class was pretty tedious and stressful. He is a gracious grader as long as you try your best on the assignments. The Micromatic simulations are the hardest and longest assignments but it gets easier once you get the hang of it. Also, 3 non-proctored exams but all very easy
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: The most condescending professor I have ever had. Instructions and due dates are not clear and course work is unorganized.  All of his instructions say to ask if you have any questions, but when you ask a question he does not give a clear answer or tells you to go back and read the instructions. Not to mention micromatics is awful.

He releases instructions for how to read his instructions, and then his instructions don't match the coursework. His posted schedules don't match and there is a lot to do. He is only reachable on Microsoft Teams, but he routinely ignores student questions. Worst class I've taken at Kennesaw.

3 Exams with a concepts and problems portion for each. He says they're open note but it's on lockdown browser so you need a second device. Homework problems can take up to hours to complete and you're left to teach yourself everything; he teaches nothing. But he offers extra credit for exams and group project is graded lightly. Not terrible.
confusing class!!!! AVOID. you practically have to teach yourself.

not tech-savvy, makes the course confusing and disorganized. can only be reached on MS Teams. "3 exams", but each exam consists of two exams. math tests are very unforgiving as each answer has to be typed in (not selected). practice exams are 100+ questions. Avoid this course unless you want to spend excessive amounts of time, or have a light load.

Be ready to put in the work. This is not an easy course load. However, Professor Teters is one of the most caring professors I have ever had. He is always available to answer questions and provide guidance via teams. Just communicate with him and you will EXCEL.

Dr Teters is an amazing teacher. He is very fair and also genuinely cares about you learning the material. He is super responsive and willing to give feedback if you are stuck on an assignment. The business simulation is really hard at first, but he provides so many examples and will literally go through your actions with you if you need. TAKE HIM!
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Although the work itself is not necessarily hard, the workload itself is the worst I've ever seen and I'm in my senior year. There is an assignment due every day even weekends. I have written an ungodly amount of essays and case studies. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE!!!!! I never write professor reviews but I felt this was needed.
Caring amazing professor Heavy on the group project and Papers
Amazing professor and amazing lecturers, lot of papers but easy, follow the instructions and respect.

Hybrid class. No discussion posts or connect thank god. Changed attendance to optional halfway through the semester. He is the MOST responsive professor I've ever had and was more than accommodating with requests for extensions. If you don't procrastinate, this is an easy course. The hardest thing is the simulation you play, takes 20hrs.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: There are multiple things due weekly, and even though the quizzes are easy you have so much more work on top of that. The "Game Scenarios" as well as the individual cases were ridiculous to complete. No point in reaching out for help, he just sends rubric.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Will never take another of his classes. Absolutely terrible in every way. LOTS of group work on top of individual work, doesn't grade an assignment unless it's 100 (so basically the class is a pass/fail). AVOID!!!

Teters does not grade an assignment unless it is 100% up to his satisfaction. He will send it back until you fix it. While this sounds great, with the amount of work and time he expects you to spend on the other assignments, it just piles up on you. He could just take off minor points. Assignments cost $$$ to do and are EXPENSIVE. Up to $70.

I took Professor Teters for an 8-week summer class in Managing your company. The first day of class I didn't like him much because of a variety of reasons, but he is actually a great guy and a great professor. Despite his dull lectures he is very personable and he is a very lenient grader so as long as you do the work you'll most likely get an A.

I took the Saturday class and it was the best decision I ever made. There are HW/quiz assignments on connect due every week. Very easy. Group project partners are picked by the professor, but he seemed to grade it very generously. There are points for attendance so go to class. NO TESTS!

The beginning of the semester was frustrating, but then I started to understand what he was trying to do. He likes to talk through scenarios a lot. There is class participation but it isn't super mandatory (just welcomed). This class is homework heavy but there aren't any tests. There were two papers that weren't hard. Attendance was for a grade.

Do not take for MGT 3200, I took him for 3100 and it was fine. There is too much math and concepts in 3200 that he simply does not teach. He relies on you self-learning from another professor's recordings. He even used the test but does not teach what is on them. Nor does it follow the book. I would highly recommend you find another professor.

I went to every class but we just went over the readings we did in the textbook the previous week. He communicates well and replies fast, but his instructions are really generic and unclear and he doesnt grade a single thing until the last week, so I had no idea what my grade was. We have to turn in all the assignments in three different places.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Professor Teters likes to talk. It's not a bad thing but in his lectures, I'm not confident I learned or understood one thing about the actual class. The entirety of the class is textbook work and there are quizzes and homework every week to make sure you're learning what you need to. No tests other than quizzes. There is a term paper at the end.

Took this class as a hybrid with one weekly class meeting. Weekly APA essays. Weekly Smart book homework that takes minimum of 3 hours. His lectures in class sound like an old business podcast. He sounds like npr. Extremely boring lecture. He is very monotone and you will fall asleep. Easy grades but ridiculous amounts of homework.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Richard Teters was a great professor for MGT 3100 if you have the chance take him if your not a good test taker like me. He does the classes off MIAs complete everyone in APA format and answer the questions at the end of the chapter and its an easy A. I learned a lot because of the connections made in MIAs go to class everyday and you will get an A
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: I don't know what class these other reviewers took, but this was an easy class. If you do the work on time and put some effort into the papers, it's an easy A. Yes, he uses Connect for the learn smarts, quizzes and self assessments, but they only take about an hour to do. Put a little bit of effort in and you will do fine. Great professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Makes the course confusing. Uses McGraw Hill Connect outside of D2L. Site has too many areas on it and is very confusing. He has no clear-cut way of instructing his class. Tries to be too critical of your work, uses APA style very critically. Online class takes up all of your time and energy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Not quite finished with the semester yet, but wanted to let those who are registering know to stay away if you can. He is unorganized, vague, and apathetic to your needs. Answers legitimate questions with answers like "just go with the flow". He gave us the wrong template for a portion of a project which required more work, but it was our fault...

I am only mid way through this class and its honestly one of the worst classes I've ever taken in college. He gives no instructions, expects 3 chapters to be read, analyzed, and quizzed on PER WEEK and on top of that has many projects scattered through. I took him online, but according to other reviews he is just as bad. AVOID.

Great professor, the people that give him bad reviews are the same people who never went to class. Seriously, super easy and insightful class, just make sure you attend every session. Has a tendency to lecture for long periods of time, however he always let us go early. Great guy and a good professor, for MGT 3200 we didn't even have any tests!

Most work is done online, while class time is mostly lectures that are less than helpful for the material. Expect an annoying group project with vague instructions. Seems like he wants to teach, but the textbook does most of the work.

Too much homework. Teters is a nice guy, but he teaches you nothing, just babbles about his business experiences. 2 online tests. Had to do a weekly journal, weekly quizzes, a group project, and chapter "assessments" where you basically had to work the problems at the end of each textbook chapter.

Mr. Teters is a fantastic teacher, however, he does not necessarily 'teach' you anything about Management. He will address things such as:  online tests, online quizzes, and a group project. Every quiz question can be looked up online via google, but the Tests are all problem based. He's a good teacher and it's an Easy A, but don't expect to learn.

Does not go over material that is on the tests. Treats the class like an online class and just talks about his experiences I class. Very sweet man, he wants to help you pass but only take him if you have time to teach yourself

I took this class online and it was very challenging. There are a lot of assignments that require a lot of your time. He intentionally gives vague directions on everything to simulate the 'real' business world so just expect that going into it. On the other hand, the tests are very reasonable and he is a VERY easy grader as long as you show effort.

Most boring class ever and he makes it even more boring by being monotoned. However, it is a fairly easy class as long as you do your work it's pretty much a satisfactory / unsatisfactory grading system. There's a group game to play which takes up the majority of the class and his tests are only 2 questions each.

Professor Teters was a nice guy and he seems knowledgeable about the general info I would need to start a business.  Attendance was only mandatory on lecture days (about half the time) and the other days were for the team simulation game.  If you read over the Micromatic manual carefully and prove that you're learning something, you can get an A.

The bulk of this course is the simulation game. As long as you can show Teters that you are learning something, he will grade you well. I got A's on everything I did. He allows you to turn in everything in advance for critique. It can seem a little overwhelming, but he really just wants to see that you are thinking/applying concepts!

Teters is a nice guy.He has a lot of experience in the business world but he has a strange method of teaching.Rarely teaches from the book.Simulation game is a huge part of your grade and a pain.No tests or quizzes, just the final exam.If you get to know him personally and come to class he'll have mercy on you come grading time.Syllabus is useless.

Teters is a nice guy. Syllabus was pretty much useless but that kinda works in your favor. Most of the semester is spent playing the simulation. Never read the book. Ask questions, pay attention and play the game a lot and you should do OK.

Worst professor I have had at KSU.I have to say I have not learned one valuable piece of information in this class. The syllabus was a joke. He used another professor?s outline and changed it almost weekly.There was no organization at all.I feel as if I should retake this class with a competent professor and his class was a waste of tuition money.
